title: Questor: Why did Woodford fail? Because he broke these two key investment principles
text:
If you want to spot the next fund disaster in the making, just look for these two signs

If Questor had to summarise what went wrong for Neil Woodford in one word, that word would be “income”.

The failure of the flagship Woodford Equity Income fund to pay the income it promised (it paid an average of 0.94p a quarter per unit, against a target of 1p) was the clearest sign that its manager was not sticking to the methods that had proved so profitable with his previous funds at Invesco Perpetual.
